content:
• Monday, December 10, 2018
  • AYR

    Aircastle -4% as it seeks to repossess 11 Avianca Brazil aircraft

    • Aircastle (NYSE:AYR) -3.7% after-hours on news it terminated the leases for and began the process to repossess 11 Airbus aircraft that had been on lease to Avianca Brazil (NYSE:AVH) because of a delinquent receivables problem with the airline.
    • AYR says it is already in remarketing discussions with several potential customers.
    • As a result of the terminations, AYR lowers its Q4 lease rental revenue guidance to $182M-$184M from $187M-$191M previously.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:49 PM | 26 Comments
  • CARS

    Cars.com told to improve performance by shareholder Starboard

    • Cars.com (NYSE:CARS) +1.5% after-hours as activist shareholder Starboard Value, which owns slightly less than 10% of the company, says the board should set financial targets that reflect the true earnings potential of the company as well as a plan to achieve the targets.
    • The hedge fund says CARS has suffered a continuous trend of customer losses and revenue declines amid higher operating expenses, resulting in a pattern of missing expectations and cutting guidance.
    • Starboard says CARS should generate ~$4/share of adjusted free cash flow by the end of 2020 if the company was properly managed.
    • Starboard says the company should take more substantive actions if shareholders do not see progress soon, including potential management changes and a potential sale of the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:18 PM
  • CAMP

    CalAmp -9.6% as supply issues force guidance cut

    • CalAmp (NASDAQ:CAMP) is 9.6% lower after it trimmed its Q3 forecast based on supply chain issues.
    • The company had discussed accelerated supply chain diversification on Sept. 27, against a backdrop of escalated trade tensions with China.
    • "During the third quarter, CalAmp experienced various supply disruptions related to this transition, as well as extended lead times driven by component shortages," the company says. "This resulted in inbound product supply delays at quarter end and impacted the Company's ability to ship certain products to meet customer demand."
    • It's now guiding to GAAP revenues of $88M-$89M and EPS of -$0.03 to -$0.01; on a non-GAAP basis, it's forecasting EBITDA of $10.5M-$11.5M and EPS of $0.23-$0.25 (below consensus for $0.32).
    • It's got a call set to discuss Q3 results and Q4 outlook for 4:30 p.m. ET on Dec. 20.
    • The company also says its board has authorized a stock repurchase program of $20M.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:48 PM | 1 Comment
  • ASNA

    ASNA, CASY & SFIX among notable after hour movers

    • Gainers: ASNA +12.1%. RTIX +3.8%. DFRG +3.3%. ACA +3.3%. STAY +2.8%.
    • Losers: SFIX -12.4%. FRTA -7.8%. CASY -7.6%. NX -4.9%. RARX -3.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:36 PM | 3 Comments
  • CBS

    CBS has deal to sell Television City for $750M; shares +2.3%

    • After more than a year of floating the sale, CBS has a deal to sell its iconic Television City production studios for $750M.
    • Hackman Capital Partners will take over the 25-acre property and sound stage along with the rights to use the Television City trademark.
    • Shares are up 2.3% after hours.
    • Last month, reports had Hackman winning an auction with a total that was expected to top $700M.
    • As expected, CBS has secured continuing rights to produce programs on the campus for at least five years. Among the series produced there are The Late Late Show with James Corden, The Price is Right, The Young and the Restless and The Bold and the Beautiful.
    • Primary production for CBS TV will still be at the 40-acre CBS Studios Center in Studio City, Calif.
    • "The sale of Television City unlocks significant value, increasing CBS' financial flexibility, including the ability to redeploy capital for strategic growth initiatives such as additional content investment," says interim CEO Joe Ianniello.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:22 PM | 4 Comments
  • SFIX

    Stitch Fix turns down 14% after low-side EBITDA forecast

    • Stitch Fix (NASDAQ:SFIX) has turned lower after an initial post-earnings pop, now down 14%, after guiding low on Q2 underlying earnings.
    • On its conference call, the company's guiding to Q2 revenues of $360M-$368M (vs. consensus for $362.7M, and marking growth of 22-24%) and adjusted EBITDA of $8M-$12M, below consensus for $12.8M (and representing EBITDA margin of 2.2-3.3%).
    • For the full year, it sees net revenues of $1.49B-$1.53B (in line with consensus for $1.51B) and EBITDA of $20M-$40M vs. expectations for $34.8M.
    • It expects to spend less on advertising in Q2 vs. Q1.
    • Earnings call slides
     
     
     
     
    | 5:14 PM | 53 Comments
  • BRT

    BRT Apartments -1.0% after Q4 revenue miss

    • BRT Apartments (NYSE:BRT) slips 1.0% after Q4 revenue of $30.2M missed consensus estimate of $31.1M; compares with $26.9M a year ago.
    • Q4 adjusted FFO per share of 20 cents match consensus; compares with 19 cents a year ago.
    • "We expect to benefit in 2019 from our value-add program and the demographic and economic tailwinds supporting rental housing," says President and CEO Jeffrey A. Gould.
    • Previously: BRT Apartments FFO in-line, misses on revenue (Dec. 10)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:07 PM
  • OKTA

    Guggenheim starts Okta at Buy, calls Best Idea

    • Guggenheim starts Okta (NASDAQ:OKTA) at Buy with a $79 price target and adds the company to its Best Idea list.
    • Last week, Okta reported Q3 results with upside guidance.
    • Okta shares are up 1% aftermarket to $65.20.
    • Previously: Okta reports Q3 beats, upside guidance (Dec. 5)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:59 PM | 3 Comments
  • DBX

    Dropbox, Box gain on William Blair initiations

    • William Blair starts Dropbox (NASDAQ:DBX) and Box (NYSE:BOX) with Outperform ratings.
    • Late last month, Box reported Q3 beats with in-line guidance.
    • Dropbox's Q3 beat estimates and had an upside guide for Q4.
    • Dropbox shares are up 1% aftermarket and Box gains 0.6%.
    • Previously: Box +2.3% on Q3 beats, in-line guide (Nov. 28)
    • Previously: Dropbox +5.8% on Q3 beats (Nov. 8)
    • Previously: Dropbox guides upside Q4 (Nov. 9)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:51 PM | 8 Comments
  • ASNA

    Post-earnings rally for Ascena Retail

    • Ascena Retail (NASDAQ:ASNA) jumps after edging past estimates with its FQ1 report.
    • Comparable sales were up 3% during the quarter, led by strength with the Justice brand (+12% comp), Ann Taylor and Loft.
    • Gross margin came in at 59.4% of sales vs. 60.7% a year ago and 60.2% consensus.
    • Looking ahead, the company expects Q2 sales of $1.68B to $1.71B vs. $1.70B consensus.
    • CEO update: "In parallel with execution of strategic brand growth initiatives, we continue to evaluate all opportunities to increase shareholder value, including ongoing assessment of our brand portfolio, development of our platform capability to enable delivery of third party services, and potential new channels of distribution."
    • ASNA +5.8% AH to $2.90
    • Previously: Ascena Retail Group beats by $0.02, beats on revenue (Dec. 10)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:31 PM | 1 Comment
  • SEAC

    SeaChange beats, but cuts guidance as revenues decline

    • SeaChange (NASDAQ:SEAC) topped expectations on top and bottom lines with its Q3 results, though revenues fell nearly 21% and the company cut guidance below consensus.
    • Cost of revenues on products went up more than 43%, however, pinching gross profit by 31%.
    • Shares are down 18.5% in relatively light trading after hours.
    • The company swung to an operating loss of $2.51M, from a year-ago gain of $920,000. Net loss widened to $3.83M from a year-ago loss of $220,000.
    • Revenue breakout: Products, $8.27M (down 25.6%); Services, $10.34M (down 16%).
    • Liquidity was $32.4M with no debt outstanding.
    • It's guiding to Q4 revenue of $16M-$20M (light of expected $25.3M) and EPS of -$0.05 to $0.02 (well short of consensus for $0.14).
    • For the full year, it's trimmed revenue guidance to $61M-$65M (short of expected $69.7M) and operating income of -$0.34 to -$0.27.
    • Conference call to come at 5 p.m. ET.
    • Previously: SeaChange beats by $0.03, beats on revenue (Dec. 10 2018)
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM | 11 Comments
  • CRMD

    CorMedix to sell NJ tax credits for ~$5M; shares up 2% after hours

    • CorMedix (NYSEMKT:CRMD) announces that the New Jersey Economic Development Authority has signed off on its proposed sale of ~$5.4M in state tax credits to a third party for ~$5M in cash.
    • The state's program allows small tech companies to sell up to $15M in accrued tax credits as a way to raise money.
    • Shares are up 2% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM | 9 Comments
  • WTW

    Weight Watchers gains on M&A hopes

    • Weight Watchers (NYSE:WTW) ended the day up 6.0% after D.A. Davidson suggested that the company could attract a bidder at at a takeover price as high as $67.
    • The focus on Weight Watchers increased today after Nutrisystem received a buyout offer of its own.
    • Previously: Tivity Health lands Nutrisystem (Dec. 10)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM | 2 Comments
  • SFIX

    Stitch Fix +6% after strong FQ1 report

    • Stitch Fix (NASDAQ:SFIX) pops after topping estimates with both lines of its FQ1 report.
    • The retailer also posted EBITDA of $14.3M during the quarter vs. $8.0M consensus.
    • Stitch Fix's active client list grew 22% to 2.9M during the quarter.
    • SFIX +6.08% AH to $27.55.
    • Previously: Stitch Fix beats by $0.07, beats on revenue (Dec. 10)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM | 12 Comments
  • SFIX

    Stitch Fix beats by $0.07, beats on revenue

    • Stitch Fix (NASDAQ:SFIX): Q1 GAAP EPS of $0.10 beats by $0.07.
    • Revenue of $366.24M (+23.9% Y/Y) beats by $8.18M.
    • Shares +9%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM | 2 Comments
  • ASNA

    Ascena Retail Group beats by $0.02, beats on revenue

    • Ascena Retail Group (NASDAQ:ASNA): Q1 Non-GAAP EPS of $0.06 beats by $0.02; GAAP EPS of $0.03.
    • Revenue of $1.59B (flat Y/Y) beats by $30M.
    • Shares +15%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM | 4 Comments
  • RARX

    Ra Pharma readies $100M stock offering; shares down 2% after hours

    • Ra Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:RARX) slips 2% after hours in reaction to its $100M stock offering. Price, volume and terms have yet to be announced.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM
  • ASPU

    Aspen beats by $0.01, misses on revenue

    • Aspen (NASDAQ:ASPU): Q2 GAAP EPS of -$0.13 beats by $0.01.
    • Revenue of $8.1M (+67.0% Y/Y) misses by $0.07M.
    • Shares +3.89%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM
  • EMES

    Crude oil slides 3%, giving up gains on OPEC production deal

    • Crude oil futures erase the gains they made on Friday following OPEC's decision to cut production: January WTI settled -3.1% to $51/bbl after rising 3.3% last week, and Brent -2.8% ended at $59.97/bbl following last week's 3.7% jump.
    • "It didn’t take long for Friday’s OPEC+ planned production to get priced in as focus turned back to the potential impact of worsening U.S.-China trade tensions," says Colin Cieszynski, chief market strategist at SIA Wealth Management.
    • Oil’s gains risk being quelled by uncertainty over how the OPEC+ coalition will implement its deal to cut output, Morgan Stanley analysts say.
    • While prices can continue to rise as the pact significantly decreases the possibility of a glut, crude’s four-year high reached in early October is unlikely to be reached again in coming quarters, Stanley says.
    • Goldman Sachs says the oil market may rebalance in H1 2019 as Iranian production is squeezed by U.S. sanctions and a lack of new pipeline out of the Permian Basin, but the firm is less optimistic about H2 as "OPEC+ attempts to sequentially grow and given an expected stabilization in Iran production, the unleashing of the Permian growth and back-end loaded growth in Canada, Brazil and Norway."
    • Among today's notable decliners: EMES -17.9%, WTI -13.9%, WFT -11.5%, HCLP -10%, HK -8.6%, REI -8.2%, MTRD -7.4%, SLCA -7.3%, ESV -7%, OAS -6.5%, KOS -6.1%, APA -5.3%, MRO -4.7%.
    • ETFs: USO, XLE, OIL, UWT, UCO, VDE, XOP, DWT, ERX, OIH, SCO, BNO, DBO, ERY, DIG, BGR, GUSH, DTO, FENY, USL, IYE, DUG, DRIP, IEO, FIF, DNO, NDP, PXE, OLO, RYE, PXJ, SZO, CRAK, FXN, OLEM, WTIU, DDG, OILK, NANR, OILX, WTID, USOI, USOU, USOD, FTXN, JHME, ERYY, ERGF, OILD, OILU, USAI
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM | 61 Comments
  • AKAO

    Achaogen up 24% after FDA nod on plazomicin test

    • Nano cap Achaogen (AKAO +23.7%) is up on double normal volume. This morning, it announced that the FDA has cleared Thermo Fisher Scientific's QMS Plazomicin Immunoassay that quantitatively measures the amount of plazomicin in human plasma. The test, performed on TMO's automated analyzers, will be used as an aid in the management of patients with complicated urinary tract infections (cUTIs) who are receiving the drug, branded as ZEMDRI.
    • The stock has been in a consistent down trend since June when the FDA approved the drug for cUTI but not for bloodstream infections. Shares have sold off ~86% since then.
    • On the working capital front, at the end of September it had $58.2M in quick assets while operations consumed $133.3M during the first three quarters of the year.
    • Previously: Achaogen down 26% premarket after Ad Com vote (May 3)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:33 PM | 23 Comments
  • XPER

    Xperi, Veritone and Xperi among tech movers

    • Gainers: Xperi (NASDAQ:XPER) +46%. Veritone (NASDAQ:VERI) +22%. Systemax (NYSE:SYX) +18%. Uxin (NASDAQ:UXIN) +16%. SolarWinds (NYSE:SWI) +9%.
    • Losers: China Finance Online (NASDAQ:JRJC) -20%. Himax Technologies (NASDAQ:HIMX) -18%. Marin Software (NASDAQ:MRIN) -12%. Safe-T Group (NASDAQ:SFET) -12%. Comtech Telecommunications (NASDAQ:CMTL) -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:01 PM
  • ESTC

    Elastic doubles down on open source commitment

    • Elastic (NYSE:ESTC) announces joining the Cloud Native Computing Foundation to increase its commitment to open cloud native technologies.
    • In tandem, Elastic announces that it's now possible to deploy Elasticsearch and Kibana to Kubernetes with Helm, the Kubernetes package manager. 
    • Elastic shares are up 6.5% to $73.60.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:41 PM | 1 Comment
  • YELP

    SunTrust: Comparables suggest Yelp could draw $50/share in sale

    • Weighing a potential sale of Yelp (NYSE:YELP), SunTrust suggests the company could be worth closer to $50/share in a transaction after looking at recent transactions.
    • Yelp's up 2.9% currently to $35.59/share; holder SQN Investors wrote a letter to the board asking for new members and consideration of a sale, saying its patience has worn out.
    • SunTrust is looking to recent sales of Pandora and Web.com coming at about four times 2019 enterprise value/gross profit, suggesting the companies are alike because of big insider sales forces and similar operating expenditure structures. (h/t Bloomberg)
    • It's sticking with a Hold rating and $35 price target as is.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:38 PM | 2 Comments
  • FTNT

    Fortinet +4% on securing global network for Indian distributor

    • Fortinet (NASDAQ:FTNT) announces that Indian distribution and logistics company DTDC Express bolstered its existing Fortinet Security Fabric deployment by modernizing data center and branch firewalls.
    • The existing deployment spans 30 global offices and 450 branches.
    • FTNT is up 3.9% to $74.43.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:20 PM
  • TWST

    Twist Bio down 14% on expanded Agilent complaint over alleged theft of trade secrets

    • Twist Bioscience (TWST -13.8%) slumps on modestly higher volume in response to its disclosure that a California court has granted plaintiff Agilent's (A -0.2%) motion to add two additional defendants, current TWST employee Dr. Siyuan Chen, and former CFO Solange Glaize, to its lawsuit claiming that the company and certain employees stole confidential documents related to its proprietary oligonucleotide synthesis technology.
    • The court denied its motion for a protective order and set no limits on discovery.
    • Agilent filed suit against the company and CEO Emily Leproust in February 2016. The trial date is February 24, 2020. Unsurprisingly, the defendants intend to "vigorously" dispute the allegations.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:07 PM | 2 Comments
  • FGP

    Ferrellgas Partners and SilverCrest Metals among Energy/Materials gainers; Sundance Energy Australia and Mountain Province Diamonds among losers

    • Gainers: Ferrellgas Partners (NYSE:FGP) +8%. SilverCrest Metals (NYSEMKT:SILV) +8%. Ultra Petroleum (NASDAQ:UPL) +6%. Superior Drilling Products (NYSEMKT:SDPI) +7%.
    • Losers: Sundance Energy Australia (NASDAQ:SNDE) -15%. Mountain Province Diamonds (NYSEMKT:MPVD) -15%. Marrone Bio Innovations (NASDAQ:MBII) -12%. PEDEVCO (NYSEMKT:PED) -12%. Earthstone Energy (NASDAQ:ESTE) -11%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:59 PM
  • WDC

    Mizuho cuts Western Digital's target on NAND, SSD

    • Mizuho maintains a Neutral rating on Western Digital (NYSE:WDC) and drops the target from $55 to $49.
    • Analyst Vijay Rakesh joins the voices warning on NAND pricing.
    • Rakesh: "We continue to see challenges for WDC as NAND pricing continues to decline with seasonality, and challenges from handsets, tariffs and macro demand affect visibility.:
    • The analyst says WDC faces slower datacenter spend with inventory headwinds and thinks supply and seasonality could drive further revenue and margin declines into 1H19 as SSD pricing declines.
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word.
    • Western Digital shares are down 1.3% to $41.50.
    • Previously: Micron -1.8% on Citi estimate cut (Dec. 10)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:59 PM | 13 Comments
  • CMG

    Piper Jaffray positive on Chipotle

    • Piper Jaffray thinks an improvement in Chipotle's (CMG +0.3%) brand awareness through a higher marketing spend will lead to same-store sales growth.
    • "The company is increasing Chipotle brand awareness through marketing efforts that today promote brand equity, but with a long-term plan that incorporates calls to action and iconic visual elements," advises analyst Nicole Miller Regan.
    • Piper thinks Chipotle (Overweight, $550 price target) will generate same-store sales growth of 4% in Q4.
    • Shares of Chipotle are up 62% YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:09 PM | 10 Comments
  • GOOG

    U.S. stock markets mixed as Nasdaq edges up

    • The tech-heavy Nasdaq creeps up to a gain in early afternoon trading as the Dow and S&P 500 pare earlier losses.
    • Nasdaq +0.2%, S&P -0.5%, Dow -0.7%.
    • By sector, technology rises 0.3%. Among individual stocks, Alphabet (GOOG +0.1%), Facebook (FB +2.1%), and Microsoft (MSFT +1.2%) advance.
    • Financials -1.4% and basic materials -1.4%, which includes oil & gas, experience the biggest sector declines. Individual laggards include Wells Fargo (WFC -3%), Bank of America (BAC -2.9%), Citi (C -2.4%), Occidental Petroleum (OXY -3.5%), Exxon Mobil (XOM -2.4%), and EOG Resources (EOG -2.7%).
    • Crude slides 1.5% to $51.81.
    • U.S. 10-year Treasury price slips, lifting yield by almost 1 basis point to 2.86%. Dollar index rises 0.5% to 97.14.
    • Previously: Stock losses mount amid growth concerns, trade uncertainty (Dec. 10)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:09 PM | 16 Comments
  • FIXX

    Homology Medicines up 4%

    • Thinly traded gene therapy developer Homology Medicines (FIXX +3.6%) is up on below-average volume. Shares have rallied over 42% since touching $18.20 on November 21.
    • The stock debuted at $16 in late March. Lead candidate is Phase 1/2-stage HMI-102 for phenylketonuria.
    • Other gene therapy players in the green: (MGTX +1.9%)(GNPX +3.3%)(ABEO +4.1%)(CRSP +1.6%)(EDIT +0.4%)(NTLA +2.3%)(SRPT +2%)(ZIOP +0.3%)(RGNX +1.3%)(BMRN +0.2%)(RARE +1.1%)(VYGR +0.8%)(SGMO +1.9%)(ONCE +4.2%)(ADVM +0.8%)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:08 PM | 3 Comments

  • Apple reversal leads market bounce

    • Markets are well off session lows in afternoon action, in part thanks to a speedy reversal in the shares of Apple.
    • Apple earlier was down more than 2% as Qualcomm reported winning a ban on the sale of some iPhones in China. That decline has been completely eliminated over the past 30 minutes.
    • Down nearly 2% earlier, the S&P 500 has narrowed that to just 0.6%. The Dow is off 0.8%, and the Nasdaq has turned barely positive.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:04 PM | 8 Comments
  • HX

    Hexindai leads financial gainers; LM Funding America and LexinFintech Holdings among losers

    • Gainers: Hexindai (NASDAQ:HX) +39%. Siebert Financial (NASDAQ:SIEB) +10%. eXp World Holdings (NASDAQ:EXPI) +7%. Yangtze River Port and Logistics (NASDAQ:YRIV) +7%. Yintech Investment Holdings (NASDAQ:YIN) +6%.
    • Losers: Jupai Holdings (NYSE:JP) -19%. Och-Ziff Capital Management Group (NYSE:OZM) -10%. LexinFintech Holdings (NASDAQ:LX) -9%. LM Funding America (NASDAQ:LMFA) -7%. Bancorp Of New Jersey (NYSEMKT:BKJ) -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:03 PM
  • ACET

    Generics under pressure on expanded price-fixing investigation

    • The broad market's bearishness notwithstanding, generic drug makers are predominantly in the red on the news that the investigation into alleged price-fixing by state AGs now totals 47.
    • Selected tickers: (ACET)(ACRS -3.3%)(AKRX +0.8%)(AMPH -1.9%)(AMRX -5.2%)(ANIP)(BHC -3.9%)(CHRS -3.5%)(COLL -1.9%)(EGRX +0.2%)(ENDP -3.1%)(LCI -2.6%)(MNK -2.6%)(MYL -3.2%)(PRGO -2.6%)(RDY -2.9%)(TLGT +3.7%)(TEVA -7.2%)

  • XPER

    HIMX, AXON and MRNS among notable midday movers

    • Gainers: Xperi (NASDAQ:XPER) +43%. Hexindai (NASDAQ:HX) +38%. Innovate Biopharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:INNT) +37%. Nutrisystem (NASDAQ:NTRI) +29%. Uxin (NASDAQ:UXIN) +17%. Veritone (NASDAQ:VERI) +17%. Ra Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:RARX) +14%. Kiniksa Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:KNSA) +14%. Systemax (NYSE:SYX) +14%. Sphere 3D (NASDAQ:ANY) +12%. Marinus Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:MRNS) +11%.
    • Losers: Tivity Health (NASDAQ:TVTY) -31%. MacroGenics (NASDAQ:MGNX) -26%. Axovant Sciences (NASDAQ:AXON) -25%. PEDEVCO (NYSEMKT:PED) -22%. Marine Products (NYSE:MPX) -21%. Gritstone Oncology (NASDAQ:GRTS) -15%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM

  • Tech lunch: Apple's China woes weigh, semis strong

    • The tech sector (NYSEARCA:XLK) drops 0.3% as the Huawei CFO arrest continues to stoke fears of US-China trade tensions and Qualcomm +3.4% announces a preliminary Apple -2% iPhone ban in China due to patent infringement. Add in the production cut for iPhone XR supplier Japan Display and a downgrade for Qorvo -3% and this is another rocky day for the Apple supply chain.
    • The S&P 500 IT Index is down 1.4%, the Nasdaq 100 drops 0.5%, and the Philadelphia Semiconductor Index stands apart in gaining 0.5%. Compare to the 1.6%, 1.3%, and 0.7% for the Dow, S&P 500, and Nasdaq, respectively.
    • Related Chinese tech ETFs: KWEB, CQQQ, QQQC-OLD, CWEB
    • Previously: Qualcomm wins preliminary iPhone ban in China (update) (Dec. 10)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:20 PM
  • INNT

    Innovate Bio up 23%

    • Nano cap Innovate Biopharmaceuticals (INNT +22.8%) bucks the broad market selloff on 65% higher volume. Shares are still down ~90%, however, since July.
    • Last week, it announced a collaboration with Massachusetts General Hospital aimed at understanding how certain toxins in the intestines may cause liver disease via breaching the gut vascular barrier via ethanol-induced disruption. The company expects the research to enhance its knowledge of how agents like larazotide may prevent the "leaky" barrier from worsening, thereby providing a potential treatment benefit in patients with liver disorders like NASH.
    • On the working capital front, at the end of September it had $8.1M in cash and equivalents while operations consumed $12.8M during the first three quarters of the year.
    • In late October, it inked agreements with H.C. Wainwright and Ladenburg Thalmann for the at-the-market sale of up to $40M of common stock.
    • Next Monday, December 17, management will host an investor update during which it will review its capital plan for its celiac disease clinical program and its NASH development strategy.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:19 PM | 2 Comments
  • AMZN

    Mattel, Hasbro drop on Amazon's private label toys

    • Amazon (AMZN -1.2%) is launching its first private label line of toys for toddlers and kids. TJI Research spotted the AmazonBasics product pages for some products, though shipping isn't yet available.
    • Mattel (NASDAQ:MAT) shares are down 4.5% while Hasbro (NASDAQ:HAS) drops 2.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:11 PM | 27 Comments
  • CXDC

  • MNLO

    Menlo's serlopitant successful in mid-stage pruritis study; shares up 1%

    • Thinly traded micro cap Menlo Therapeutics (MNLO +1.4%) is up on light volume following its announcement of positive results from a 204-subject Phase 2 clinical trial evaluating MTI-109 (serlopitant), branded as PSORIXA, for the treatment of pruritis (itchy skin) in psoriasis patients.
    • The study met the primary endpoint of a statistically significant proportion of patients experiencing at least a four-point reduction in a scale called WI-NRS. Specifically, 33% of patients met the criterion compared to 21% for placebo (p=0.028).
    • The trial also met the secondary endpoint of WI-NRS responder rate at week 4 (21% vs. 11%; p=0.039).
    • The safety profile of MTI-109 was similar to control.
    • The company plans to meet with the FDA in H1 2019 to discuss the data and clarify the parameters of Phase 3 studies, expected to start soon thereafter.
    • Enrollment is underway in two Phase 3 trials evaluating serlopitant for the treatment of pruritis in patients with prurigo nodularis. Topline data are expected in Q1 2020.
    • Enrollment should start in the next few weeks in a Phase 2 study in idiopathic (unknown cause) pruritis.
    • Menlo licensed serlopitant, a small molecule neurokinin 1 receptor (NK1) antagonist, from Merck in 2012.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM

  • QCOM

    Qualcomm wins preliminary iPhone ban in China (update)

    • Qualcomm (NASDAQ:QCOM) says it has won a preliminary order from a Chinese court banning imports and sales of several Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) iPhone models in the region.
    • The Fuzhou Intermediate People’s Court order affects the iPhone 6S to iPhone X, which the court found violated two of Qualcomm's software-related patents for photograph resizing and touch screen application management.
    • Apple could update the software to remove the infringing features and continue selling the phones.
    • Earlier this year, the same court banned the import of some Micron chips.
    • In Citi's Apple target cut this morning, the firm cited Apple's exposure to China, which accounts for about 18% of total sales.
    • Apple shares are down 1.3% premarket. Qualcomm shares are up 2.2%.
    • Previously: Citi has $125 bear case for Apple (Dec. 10)
    • Update: Apple tells CNBC's David Faber that all iPhone models remain available to customers in China.
    • Apple: "Qualcomm's effort to ban our products is another desperate move by a company whose illegal practices are under investigation by regulators around the world. All iPhone models remain available for our customers in China. Qualcomm is asserting three patents they had never raised before, including one which has already been invalidated. We will pursue all our legal options through the courts."
     
     
     
     
    | 9:05 AM | 171 Comments
